question.title: How to set a value in a dropdown overlapped by a div?
question.body:
I am trying to select an option in a dropdown using Selenium with Java on a frontend built with Angular, but I’m having an issue because an exception is thrown in Firefox when I try to set an option by index. It says the element is not clickable at that point because a div is obscuring it.

Code:

private void setSelect(int index) {
  WebDriverWait wait = new WebDriverWait(driver, Duration.ofSeconds(15));
  WebElement element = wait.until(
      ExpectedConditions.elementToBeClickable(By.id("establishment")));
  Select select = new Select(element);
  select.selectByIndex(index);
}

Exception:

org.openqa.selenium.ElementClickInterceptedException: Element <select id="establishment" class="ng-untouched ng-pristine ng-invalid" name="establishment"> is not clickable at point (424,207) because another element <div class="col mx-2 p-2"> obscures it
Build info: version: '4.31.0', revision: '1ef9f18787*'
System info: os.name: 'Mac OS X', os.arch: 'aarch64', os.version: '15.4', java.version: '17.0.15'
Driver info: org.openqa.selenium.firefox.FirefoxDriver
Command: [addaf5d3-b02c-447a-9d01-1a1422957aaa, clickElement {id=a137e696-b1bc-4f64-9c3c-1ddd8fe00207}]
Capabilities {acceptInsecureCerts: true, browserName: firefox, browserVersion: 137.0.1, moz:accessibilityChecks: false, moz:buildID: 20250407111027, moz:geckodriverVersion: 0.36.0, moz:headless: false, moz:platformVersion: 24.4.0, moz:processID: 4445, moz:profile: /var/folders/xg/wxvbxtzn44j..., moz:shutdownTimeout: 60000, moz:webdriverClick: true, moz:windowless: false, pageLoadStrategy: normal, platformName: mac, proxy: Proxy(), setWindowRect: true, strictFileInteractability: false, timeouts: {implicit: 0, pageLoad: 300000, script: 30000}, unhandledPromptBehavior: dismiss and notify, userAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Int...}
Element: [[[[FirefoxDriver: firefox on mac (addaf5d3-b02c-447a-9d01-1a1422957aaa)] -> id: establishment]] -> tag name: option]
Session ID: addaf5d3-b02c-447a-9d01-1a1422957aaa

HTML Code:

<label _ngcontent-ng-c668520883="" class="form-label" for="establishment"> Estabelecimento </label>
<div _ngcontent-ng-c668520883="">
  <div _ngcontent-ng-c668520883="">
    <select _ngcontent-ng-c668520883="" autocomplete="false" style="height: 30px; width: 16rem;" name="establishment" id="establishment" class="ng-pristine ng-invalid ng-touched">
      <option _ngcontent-ng-c668520883="" disabled="" class="mb-1" value="ESTABLISHMENT"> Selecionar Estabelecimento </option>
      <option _ngcontent-ng-c668520883="" class="my-3" value="Loja 002"> Loja 002 </option>
      <option _ngcontent-ng-c668520883="" class="my-3" value="Loja 001"> Loja 001 </option>
    </select>
  </div>
</div>
<div _ngcontent-ng-c668520883="" class="error-message text-danger">
  <div _ngcontent-ng-c668520883="">*Campo Obrigatório.</div>
</div>

I’ve already tried most of the solutions I found on the internet, like using JavaScript code to click on the element and using a wait object to wait until the element is displayed or available to click. I also tried to manipulate the element and even delete it, but nothing helped.

question_comments.body: Yes, it does, it is the first thing the script does is maximize the window. I tried to hide this div with JavaScript but the selected was hid too and others attempts to handle the select with javaScript didn't work to me.

Find this element <div class="col mx-2 p-2"> which is hiding the target element and handle it by getting out of the way. Does your script maximize the browser before performing actions? If not try doing it, sometimes these kind of exceptions can be handled just by a maximized window. driver.manage().window().maximize();
The code you posted doesn't click the element. You've got code somewhere else triggering that exception.
